newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Sri Lanka confirms buys diesel/jet from Glencore.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka confirms buys diesel/jet from Glencore.

text.p: Sri Lanka's state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corp's (CPC) has confirmed it has awarded a tender to buy diesel and jet fuel for April 11-12 delivery to Swiss trader Glencore, a company official said on Thursday.

Glencore sold 180,000 barrels of 1.0-percent sulphur diesel at 47 cents per barrel premium to Singapore spot quotes, and 80,000 barrels of jet fuel at a 40-cent premium, both on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis to Colombo.
The tender closed on March 18, and was valid until March 20.
Earlier, traders said Glencore had made the best offer into the tender.
In its last tender, CPC purchased from Glencore 220,000 barrels of diesel at a 65-cent premium, and 40,000 barrels of jet fuel at a 75-cent premium, c-and-f Colombo.
A CPC official said March 4 that Sri Lanka would import 700,000 tonnes of diesel in 1997 compared with 600,000 tonnes in 1996 owing to greater reliance on diesel generated power.
